title: The quiet, deserted meadows of Kashmir
content: Only 28 of the 48 destinations in the Kashmir Valley that were closed after the terror attack in Pahalgam have been reopened. While waiting for the Lieutenant Governor to give clearance to the rest to resume operations, locals who are dependent on tourism for their livelihoods worry about unpaid loans and unsteady jobs. Peerzada Ashiq reports on how the incident continues to impact tourism

title: Students alleges caste discrimination by teachers in Alawalpur village adopted by Ravi Shankar Prasad
content: The Students also alleged that they are forced to do the work which they are not supposed to do like brooming the class, opening the gate, washing their own plates and glasses after mid-day meal and shutting the doors and windows after the classes get over

title: J&K HC court order on PIL related to undertrials surprising, unfortunate: Mehbooba
content: She said the court was the last resort for her “to ensure that undertrials who have no serious charges” are brought back to Kashmir

title: Disintegration talk is rumour-mongering, BJD will survive for generations: Naveen Patnaik
content: The regional party dismisses possible announcement of successor to Mr. Patnaik on its 29th foundation day as mischief

title: Special drive under way to track drunk driving in Kozhikode city
content: SoToxa machines have been made available for the enforcement wings for conducting rapid screening of suspected drivers

title: Chhattisgarh liquor scam: ED files final prosecution complaint
content: Among the new 59 accused are former Deputy Secretary at Chief Minister's office Soumya Chaurasia, former IAS officer Niranjan Das, liquor licence holders, liquor manufacturers and excise department officials

title: Kerala CM slams Karnataka demolitions, calls it ‘bulldozer justice’
content: As per media reports, a demolition drive at Yelahanka last week pulled down more than 200 houses in Waseem Layout and Fakir Colony

title: Madras High Court grants interim bail to ‘Savukku’ Shankar in 17 criminal cases
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and P. Dhanabal say that repeated curtailment of his personal liberty can only be construed as abuse of process of law

title: After Jabalpur, Christmas celebration disrupted in Indore; mob vandalises decorations
content: The viral video shows two men tearing down a Christmas tree and throwing away decoration items even as many in the mob chanted religious slogans like “Jai Siya Ram”

title: Tripura youth dies after assault over racial slurs in Dehradun
content: While the youth and his brother were buying some household things, a few drunk men started using cast based slurs against the deceased

title: ED dismisses allegations that sand mining survey is illegal
content: The agency submits rejoinder to the charges levelled by the Tamil Nadu government and alleges that the latter has been abetting illegal sand mining or has interests in protecting the practice

title: Toddler dies after falling into water tank near Gudiyatham
content: The family checked the CCTV footage of the house and found that the toddler was walking towards the water tank

title: IIT Madras gears up for Shaastra 2026
content: This year’s theme, ‘Artifacts of Arcade’, reimagines the festival as an interactive, game-like ecosystem where each competition or workshop feels like a new level to conquer

title: Mamata opposing CAA against interest of Bengali Hindus claims BJP; CAA has nothing to do with citizenship retorts TMC
content: The war of words on CAA between the BJP and the TMC have come to the fore when Bangladesh is on the boil and the BJP is raising the issue of attack on Hindus in the neighbouring country

title: West Bengal SIR: Hearings for 32 lakh ‘unmapped’ electors to begin on December 27
content: Hearings to start across 3,234 desks across the State; citizenship certificates obtained under CAA can be submitted for new voter applications, CEO says

title: The Hindu FIC to organise career seminar at KITS, Guntur on December 29
content: Experts will guide students on emerging job opportunities, industry trends and skill development during interactive sessions

title: YSRCP spreading falsehood about Tirumala temple for political gain: TDP leader
content: The coalition government is efficiently managing the unprecedented rush of devotees at Tirumala and other temples, says Vemuri Anand Surya

title: NTR District tops A.P. in ‘Speed of Doing’ in governance and service delivery
content: Of the targeted 1,600 MSME registrations in 2025-26 fiscal year, the process have been completed for 1,121, says Minister Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Andhra Pradesh reported 8,200 fatal and 10,600 non-fatal accidents in 2025
content: Andhra Pradesh registered 17,039 deaths in 2023 due to road accidents when compared to 16,693 deaths in 2022, suggest NCRB data

title: V. Sivankutty inaugurates State-level NSS residential camp
content: Based on the theme ‘Youth for the Holistic Development of the Village,’ this year’s camp is envisioned under the title ‘Life-giving Stream of Human Love that will Continue to Flow’

title: Government fails to define Aravallis despite over a year’s effort
content: The Supreme Court’s threat of contempt proceedings against committee members prodded them into submitting a definition that only protects hills above 100m from mining activities, sparking public outrage

title: Officials suspended over temple construction on govt. land in West Godavari district
content: The construction was carried out on a land belonging to Zilla Parishad, in violation of the directives of High Court, leading to contempt proceedings

title: Call to protect biodiversity-rich underwater ecosystem off Thiruvananthapuram coast
content: Researchers document underwater rocky habitat, between Adimalathura and Poovar, which is rich in fish wealth known to local fishers as ‘Panthakallu’

title: CBI moves Supreme Court against bail to Sengar in Unnao rape case; protests continue
content: Sengar’s petition was vehemently opposed by the CBI and the victim through their counsels in the Delhi HC, say officials; several women sat outside the court holding placards that sought justice for the survivor

title: Bangladesh unrest: Please save us, open borders - Hindus send SOS from Dhaka
content: Hindus in Bangladesh are pleading with India to open its borders, fearing escalating violence and persecution following recent lynchings.  Concerns are heightened by the potential return of a hardline BNP leader, with minorities feeling trapped and vulnerable.  Activists criticize Indian Hindu organizations for inaction, warning of a potential 'holocaust' if borders remain closed.

title: PM Rashtriya Bal Puraskar: From Sindoor to sports - stories of valour in the spotlight
content: President Murmu honored 20 young achievers with the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar for their bravery, social service, and talent. Stories like Shavan Singh's support for soldiers and Vansh Tayal's care for an abandoned child highlight remarkable courage and compassion. The awards celebrated exceptional achievements across various fields, inspiring a nation.

title: Indigo crisis: ‘Exemplary’ action on airline likely as DGCA tables report
content: Government prepares for strong action against IndiGo after a major schedule collapse.  A DGCA report has been submitted to the civil aviation ministry.  This report details the reasons behind the widespread flight disruptions.  The government aims to ensure IndiGo improves its operations.  Steep fines and regulatory scrutiny are anticipated for the airline and some officials.

title: Acting on 'sixth sense', Supreme Court quashes rape conviction
content: The Supreme Court, guided by a 'sixth sense,' intervened in a rape conviction case. Observing a consensual relationship that soured, the court facilitated a marriage between the convict and victim. Following their union and happy cohabitation, the apex court quashed the 10-year conviction, invoking its powers to deliver complete justice.

title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt may have agreed with Elon Musk's warning to US government on China
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt highlights America's stagnant electricity generation, contrasting it with China's massive renewable energy investments, including nuclear and solar.  Elon Musk echoes these concerns, warning of a significant competitive disadvantage for the US as China rapidly expands its power capacity, leaving America behind in the global energy race.

title: Uttar Pradesh: 19% voters 'uncollectable' as SIR enumeration ends
content: Uttar Pradesh faces a significant challenge with 2.89 crore voters deemed 'uncollectable' during a special revision. This includes those who have shifted, passed away, or are untraceable. Lucknow alone saw 12 lakh voters uncollectable. The state aims for a clean electoral roll by February 2026, with draft lists due December 31, 2025.

title: Himachal Pradesh: Doctors launch indefinite strike after colleague sacked over assault
content: Resident doctors in Himachal Pradesh have launched an indefinite strike, demanding the reinstatement of a doctor sacked for assaulting a patient. Despite a promise of a fresh inquiry, doctors deem the termination unjust, citing a lack of consideration for the doctor's perspective. The protest has disrupted routine medical services across the state.

title: Hindus form party in Bangladesh; prepare to fight upcoming polls
content: Amidst persecution, Bangladesh Minority Janta Party (BMJP) is set to contest 91 seats in the upcoming polls, targeting Hindu and minority votes. The party president seeks alliances with mainstream parties like BNP to ensure minority safety and urges India to shift its support from Awami League to champion the cause of persecuted Hindus.

title: Google CEO shares AI-made Xmas photo: Elon Musk reacts; post goes viral
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai's AI-generated Christmas greeting featuring himself and his dog, Jeffree, in a custom snow globe image, garnered significant attention on X.

title: Amit Shah calls for creation of ‘anti-terrorism grid’; urges common ATS
content: Union home minister Amit Shah has called for a nationwide upgrade of anti-terror infrastructure, advocating for an "impenetrable anti-terrorism grid" and a common ATS structure across states. He also announced a "360-degree strike" plan against organised crime, emphasizing data sharing and technological integration to combat evolving threats and ensure future security.

title: PM Modi lauds Sahibzadas' supreme sacrifice; vows to end 'slave mentality' in 10 years
content: Prime Minister Modi lauded the Sahibzadas' supreme sacrifice as a testament to India's courage against religious fanaticism. He emphasized that their story, suppressed for decades due to a colonial mindset, is now being brought to the forefront.

title: Ilia Topuria vs Alex Pereira net worth 2025: Who’s richer in the UFC?
content: Ilia Topuria and Alex Pereira are two of the UFC’s biggest names in 2025. Alex Pereira leads in net worth thanks to longer time in main events and title fights. Ilia Topuria is rising fast after winning gold in 2024. Both continue building legacies and strong earnings inside the UFC.

title: Bill Gates on co-founder Paul Allen: ‘He was a problem’; got him drunk, gave him marijuana
content: In his memoir, Bill Gates reveals how co-founder Paul Allen influenced his early experimentation with drugs and alcohol, including LSD and marijuana. Gates also recounts Steve Jobs' suggestion to try hallucinogens for product appeal, a notion he ultimately rejected. Despite these youthful explorations, Gates went on to co-found Microsoft and achieve billionaire status.

title: Paris metro stabbing: Knife-wielding man stabs three women; suspect arrested
content: Three women suffered minor injuries after a knife attack on Paris Metro's Line 3 Friday afternoon. The assaults occurred at Arts-et-Métiers, République, and Opéra stations. The suspect, reportedly a mentally unstable individual of Malian origin, fled but was apprehended at his Sarcelles home. Authorities have ruled out terrorism.

title: Ayesha Curry admits 'escaping' her four kids amid resurfaced remarks
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, has been in the spotlight over the last few months due to her controversial remarks about not wanting a marriage and children when she was young. While these comments had sparked outrage, Ayesha Curry had also opened up about how she takes time off from being a mother.

title: Standards for incense sticks notified: Govt bans hazardous chemicals; new norms voluntary
content: India has introduced quality standards for incense sticks, prohibiting harmful insecticidal chemicals and synthetic fragrance intermediates.  These new norms, aimed at improving safety and sustainability, classify agarbattis and set requirements for raw materials and burning quality.  The voluntary standard, IS 19412:2025, seeks to protect public health and the environment from potentially hazardous substances.

title: Frank Lampard & Christine Lampard net worth 2025: Football, TV success
content: Former Chelsea star Frank Lampard, a decorated player and manager, has achieved significant success in football. His wife, Christine Lampard, is a highly recognized and versatile TV presenter. Despite their public profiles, the couple prioritizes their children, maintaining a combined net worth estimated at £100 million through their respective careers and investments.

title: Jordan Spieth net worth 2025: How the golf star built his fortune
content: Jordan Spieth, a celebrated American golfer, boasts a remarkable career. He has secured three major championships and the FedEx Cup. Spieth's earnings stem from tournament wins, lucrative brand deals, and sponsorships. He continues to compete actively on the PGA Tour. Off the course, he supports charitable causes through his foundation.

title: Travis Kelce reveals Taylor Swift habit that quietly improved his health
content: Travis Kelce shared how his relationship with Taylor Swift has transformed his routines, particularly through their shared love of cooking. Swift's sourdough baking and healthier eating habits have significantly improved Kelce's gut health and overall well-being, showcasing a grounded side of the athlete as they build a life together through simple, shared rituals.

title: Vajpayee: The statesman who taught India to dream big
content: Atal Bihari Vajpayee, a statesman and former Prime Minister, is remembered for his blend of courage, compassion, and inclusiveness. His legacy of effective, corruption-free governance and concern for the common man continues to inspire transformative changes. Vajpayee's simplicity, sensitivity, and poetic nature endeared him to all, leaving an indelible mark on India's democratic journey.

title: Watch: Israeli settler rams ATV into Palestinian offering prayer; arrested
content: An Israeli settler, who is a reserve soldier, driving an ATV into a Palestinian man kneeling in prayer near the village of Deir Jarir, north of Ramallah in the West Bank. Following the incident, the IDF confirmed the soldier’s identity, confiscated his weapon, and suspended his service. The suspect was later arrested and placed under house arrest for five days.

title: Child rapist-killer must be jailed till 'virility sunset': Punjab and Haryana high court
content: A man convicted of raping and murdering a five-year-old girl will spend 30 years in prison without remission. The Punjab and Haryana High Court commuted his death sentence, stating his incarceration is necessary to prevent future crimes. The court emphasized the need for societal change to protect children and women from such barbaric acts.

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Bulls? Latest 76ers injury update
content: Joel Embiid's status for the Philadelphia 76ers' December 26, 2025, game against the Chicago Bulls remains uncertain due to ongoing right knee management. The Sixers face a short-handed roster with multiple players out or ill, while the Bulls are near full strength, creating pressure for Philadelphia in the Eastern Conference standings.

title: Hair-loss drug under lens over threat to infants, eye disorders
content: A global safety analysis of minoxidil, a common hair loss treatment, revealed over 45 infant cases of excessive hair growth due to unintended exposure. The study also flagged more than 1,600 eye-related side effects worldwide, including serious conditions. Researchers urge better oversight and awareness due to the drug's widespread availability.

title: 'Fully committed': MEA says will bring back all ‘fugitives’ after Lalit mocks govt
content: India is determined to bring back all fugitives wanted for prosecution. The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal confirmed ongoing talks with multiple governments for extradition. Delays in cases like Vijay Mallya and Lalit Modi are due to complex legalities. India remains committed to ensuring these individuals face trial in Indian courts.

title: Women's safety mirage: What crime data gets wrong & cost of speaking up
content: India's women's safety challenges persist in 2025, with official crime data revealing only a fraction of the reality. Decades of reforms haven't erased gender inequality, social stigma, and uneven justice access, leaving many incidents unreported due to fear, family pressure, and systemic barriers.  This gap between reported crimes and lived experiences highlights the ongoing struggle for safety.

title: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt announces second pregnancy
content: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt announced she is expecting her second child, a baby girl due in May. She expressed joy in growing her family and her son becoming a big brother. Leavitt also thanked President Trump and White House chief of staff Susie Wiles for their support and for fostering a pro-family environment.

title: Deja vu, India edition: 10 headlines that remained the same in 2025
content: As 2025 concludes, India witnessed recurring themes: the BJP's continued dominance, the Congress's struggle to revive, persistent air pollution in Delhi, and Pakistan-linked terror. Misogynistic remarks by politicians, language debates, and name-changing initiatives also remained prominent. Cricket stars faced retirement speculation, while the rupee's slide and the perennial 'when will you marry?' question for public figures persisted.

title: Sherrone Moore–Paige Shiver case takes new turn after coach’s release
content: Sherrone Moore and Paige Shiver's alleged affair took the internet by storm. Now, new details about their alleged affair have been released by staff working at the University of Michigan.

title: Can Ilia Topuria beat Chimaev and Pereira? Urijah Faber explains
content: Urijah Faber believes Ilia Topuria has the best chance to become the UFC’s first triple champion. Speaking on December 24, Faber praised Topuria’s power and mindset. While Alex Pereira and Khamzat Chimaev are also in the mix, Topuria’s comments about Islam Makhachev keep his title dreams alive.

title: Clearance of cosmetic sold to treat medical conditions nixed
content: India's drug regulator has revoked the registration of QR 678-Neo, an anti-hair loss product. The cosmetic was illegally marketed online for treating medical conditions like post-chemotherapy hair loss and genetic baldness. This action by the CDSCO against M/s Esthetic Centers International Pvt Ltd serves as a stern warning to the booming cosmetic market about making unapproved therapeutic claims.

title: Thiruvananthapuram mayoral election: BJP wins top post; to govern city for first time
content: In a significant political development, the BJP has secured its maiden mayoral victory in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram Municipal Corporation. V V Rajesh, a seasoned party leader, clinched the top post with crucial support, marking the NDA's first governance of a city corporation in the state.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Fisherman recovers stone sculpture of goddess Durga from Jhelum
content: A fisherman's routine catch in the Jhelum River led to a significant discovery: a stone sculpture of goddess Durga. Recovered in Baramulla, the ancient artifact was promptly handed over to the archaeology department by the Jammu and Kashmir Police. This incident highlights the region's rich cultural heritage and the police's commitment to its preservation, encouraging citizens to report similar finds.

title: J&K: Mirwaiz removes Hurriyat from social media handle; cites ‘government pressure’
content: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq removed his Hurriyat Conference chairman title from social media, citing pressure from J&K authorities. He called it a "Hobson’s choice" after his constituents were banned. This move, while drawing criticism, was defended by some as prioritizing peace. The BJP viewed it as a signal that separatism's path is over.

title: Salman Khan’s 60th birthday bash: Family & friends arrive at farmhouse
content: Salman Khan will celebrate his 60th birthday on December 27 with a close-knit gathering at his Panvel farmhouse. Staying true to his long-standing tradition, the actor has consistently chosen to mark his birthday in a private setting, either at his Galaxy Apartments home in Mumbai or at his Panvel property. As the clock ticked closer to midnight, several guests were seen arriving at the farmhouse to be part of the celebrations.

title: 'Have flagged concerns': India on US H-1B visa chaos; notes 'hardships' for families
content: India has raised concerns with the US over the abrupt cancellation of pre-scheduled H-1B visa interviews for thousands of Indian applicants. These interviews, postponed for enhanced social media vetting, have caused significant delays and hardships for skilled workers unable to return to their jobs in the US.

title: End of Ukraine-Russia war? Zelenskyy gives big update; to meet Trump soon
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy will meet US President Trump in Florida this weekend to discuss security guarantees and a nearly finished 20-point peace plan. The talks follow US diplomatic efforts, complicated by Moscow and Kyiv’s conflicting demands. While Zelenskyy is open to withdrawing troops from parts of eastern Ukraine, Russia insists Ukraine give up remaining Donbas territory.

title: NC rebukes Aga Ruhullah Mehdi: Party accuses MP of acting for Centre; demands resignation
content: National Conference has accused Srinagar MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi of acting on behalf of the central government regarding reservation policy. Minister Javed Ahmad Rana urged Mehdi to pressure his Delhi contacts to expedite the file, rather than protesting the state government's actions.

title: Shocking! Following WWE retirement; John Cena beats Cristiano Ronaldo
content: John Cena's WWE farewell saw a surprising heel turn and a WrestleMania main event victory over Cody Rhodes. He also secured the Intercontinental Championship, becoming a Grand Slam Champion.  His final match ended in a submission loss to Gunther, which Cena described as a peaceful, natural ending.  Beyond wrestling, Cena was voted 2025 Person of the Year, surpassing Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Patrick Mahomes celebrates Christmas with family as Brittany shares kids’ Santa pics
content: Patrick Mahomes spent Christmas off the field this year after suffering a season-ending ACL injury. Instead of game day, he enjoyed special moments with his wife Brittany and their three children. Brittany shared adorable photos of the kids, including daughter Golden’s first visit with Santa, capturing the family’s holiday joy despite a challenging NFL season for the Chiefs.

title: Epstein Saga: How a school teacher with fake degrees became so powerful
content: Before the private jets, the island, and the proximity to presidents and princes, Epstein was a teacher. In the mid-1970s, he taught mathematics and physics at the Dalton School in New York, one of the city’s most prestigious private institutions. He came from a working-class family in Brooklyn and had never completed a college degree. He fabricated academic credentials to secure the teaching position, and his classroom performance left little impression. Dalton administrators asked him to leave after the academic year. By any conventional measure, this should have marked the limit of his upward mobility. Instead, it marked the moment when social access began to substitute for merit.

title: Ruhullah warns of protest over reservation issue in J&K
content: Disagreements surface within National Conference as MP signals street action over open merit concerns

title: Irradiation centre near Hyderabad airport will help fruit farmers cut down damage and transportation cost
content: Agriculture department is planning to provide facilities with a cold chain capacity of 50 lakh tonnes and an additional warehousing capacity of 50 lakh metric tonnes, Agriculture Secretary said

title: Sabarimala all set for Mandala puja on Saturday
content: Ceremonial procession carrying the Thanka Anki reached the Sannidhanam on Friday evening ahead of the Mandala puja

title: Nitin Nabin attends Assam BJP executive meet, says NDA will safeguard citizens’ rights
content: BJP leader asserts firm stand on infiltration, calls on party workers to strengthen alliance ahead of 2026 State elections

title: CPI general secretary Raja calls for Left unity, warns of ‘fascist threat’ to Constitution
content: At the finale of the party’s centenary year celebration, he appealed for the reunification of the communist movement in the country

title: Farmer dies of heart attack during land acquisition meeting in Amaravati
content: Ramarao was rushed to a hospital in a government vehicle after he collapsed on a chair, but died on the way

title: State launches new campaign for good health
content: A rally was flagged off from Kasaragod on December 26 as part of the campaign promotion. It is expected to reach Thiruvananthapuram on January 1 when it will be launched formally

title: Full-body advertisements on buses fetch BMTC ₹57.5 crore a year; ₹230 crore eyed over next four years
content: As part of a renewed push to augment earnings through alternative revenue streams, BMTC, beginning January this year, introduced full-body advertisement wraps on 3,400 of its buses

title: End attacks on Hindus, Suvendu tells Bangladesh Deputy High Commission
content: Will continue protests outside the commission if attacks don’t stop, BJP leader-led delegation tells officials

title: JD (S) will contest local bodies elections independently, says HDD
content: The alliance with BJP will continue for Lok Sabha and Legislative Assembly polls, the former Prime Minister says

title: New Mayor V.K. Minimol vows crackdown on corruption, focus on mobility
content: The new Mayor of the Kochi Corporation outlines her priorities and vision for the city, which she says are aligned with the broader agenda of the UDF and will be reflected in the maiden budget to be presented by the new governing committee in the coming months.

title: Church body seeks action against those attacking Christians
content: Rev. Asir Ebenezer, general secretary, National Council of Churches in India says the Prime Minister’s visit, particularly at a time when attacks on Christians are reported from various places in the country, is perceived as a reassuring signal to the community

title: O. Sadasivan is new Mayor of Kozhikode
content: S. Jayasree of the CPI(M) is the new deputy mayor;  the whole council will work together for the development of the city, says new Mayor

title: ‘Pressed by authorities’, Mirwaiz drops Hurriyat chairman title from X bio
content: Umar Farooq’s decision draws a range of reactions from political leaders in Kashmir; Mehbooba Mufti says Hurriyat was “an idea and represented the alienation felt by people”

title: Prashant Jagtap joins Congress after quitting Sharad Pawar-led NCP faction
content: Former Pune mayor cites ideological differences ahead of civic elections; blames BJP for rising crime and worsening traffic conditions in the city

title: Crime in the garb of politics will not be tolerated, warns Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The government will also not tolerate those resorting to character assassination of political opponents through abusive posts, he asserts, and calls upon parties to maintain decency and decorum expected in a political system

title: Development, not controversy, our focus: Thrissur DCC president
content: Joseph Tajet says Congress candidates received support even from councillors who were earlier fellow travellers of the Left, underscoring that development-oriented politics prevailed over allegations and disputes

title: New Mayors, municipal chairpersons take charge in Kerala
content: V.V. Rajesh takes over as the first BJP Mayor of the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, four United Democratic Front Mayors, three of them women, take oath in Kollam, Kochi, Thrissur, and Kannur Corporations. The lone LDF Mayor, O. Sadasivan, sworn in as Mayor of the Kozhikode Corporation

title: Veligonda Project to be completed by 2026, says Minister
content: After reviewing progress, Nimmala directs completion of Tunnel-2 lining by June 2026 and faster execution of feeder canal and retaining wall works to ensure water release in the current season

title: Lighting of candles, silent marches mark tsunami anniversary
content: Memorial programmes included silent procession in 28 coastal villages in Mayiladuthurai district; Collector, SP attend programme at Tsunami Memorial Park in Nagapattinam

title: Telangana HC dismisses plea over temple land title claims
content: Petitioners moved the High Court against decision of Joint Collector confirming the order of RDO issuing Occupancy Rights Certificate to Deval Balaji

title: Naidu calls for a balance between modern science and traditional knowledge
content: He exhorts parents and teachers to narrate to children the noble characters in our epics to inculcate in them qualities like honesty, courage, commitment, responsibility and wisdom

title: Bird flu: culling of birds begins in Alappuzha
content: Officials of  Animal Husbandry department say that rapid response teams have so far culled 4,240 birds in the district

title: Rohtak MP Deepender Hooda demands Union government to file review petition on Aravalli issue
content: The Congress MP said the Centre's arguments on the Aravalli hills issue in the Supreme Court were flawed and malicious in intent

title: Analyse past year’s terror cases and boost capabilities: Amit Shah at anti-terror conference
content: He said India must be prepared to stem the threat from use of technology in terror incidents; urged State police to work in coordination with Central agencies;  praised probe in Pahalgam and Delhi blast cases as ‘outstanding examples of watertight investigation’

title: Sources: Whittingham, U-M agree to 5-year deal
content: Kyle Whittingham has agreed to a five-year deal to become Michigan's next head coach, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel and Dan Wetzel on Friday.

title: Raiders shut down DE Crosby, who leaves facility
content: The Raiders informed defensive end Maxx Crosby that he will sit out Sunday's matchup against the Giants because of a knee injury. After being told of the decision, Crosby left the team's facility.

title: Packers rule out Love, will start Willis vs. Ravens
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love has been ruled out for Saturday's game against the Ravens as he continues to deal with a concussion. Malik Willis will start for Green Bay.

title: Bills' Allen 'good to go' vs. Eagles after foot injury
content: Despite a right foot injury, Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen is set to play in Sunday's game against the Philadelphia Eagles and is not expected to have any limitations, per coach Sean McDermott.

title: Garrett eyes sack record vs. 'legendary' Rodgers
content: Defensive end Myles Garrett says it would be "special" to set the NFL's single-season sack record against "legendary" quarterback Aaron Rodgers when the Browns and Steelers square off Sunday in Cleveland.

title: Pats down 5 starters, but Henderson might play
content: The Patriots will be without five starters against the Jets, but there's still a chance rookie running back TreVeyon Henderson is available as he progresses through concussion protocol.

title: Sources: AD to miss a few games with groin strain
content: Mavericks star Anthony Davis has sustained a minor groin strain and is likely to miss a few games, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Longhorns' leading rusher Wisner to enter portal
content: Texas' leading rusher Quintrevion Wisner plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal, the running back's agent Grayson Sheena of AiC Sports told ESPN.

title: 🏆 Pop-Tarts Bowl trophy: Behind the scenes
content: How the internet's favorite bowl took things to the next level by making its trophy a kitchen appliance.

title: What you need to know for every NFL game in Week 17 -- including fantasy tips, playoff implications, predictions
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: Buzz: What we're hearing on Burrow, the red-hot Jaguars and Pro Bowl rosters
content: Here's the latest intel from around the league, including whether Joe Burrow wants out of Cincy and more.

title: Reasons for optimism and pessimism for all 10 NBA teams that played on Christmas
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram picks two stats for the teams that played on Dec. 25, and breaks down why fans should be happy and worried about their title aspirations.

title: A reason (or two) to watch every one of this year's bowl games
content: With first-year success stories, chances at redemption and general silliness, bowl season always delivers.

title: Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Buzz: Lamar Jackson doubtful for Saturday, Jordan Love ruled out
content: Check your lineups as Lamar Jackson is doubtful to play on Saturday, while Jordan Love has been ruled out.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Can anyone stop Bayern or Arsenal?
content: As we celebrate the festive season, what better gift than a rerank of the best, most in-form teams across Europe's top five leagues?

title: How much is each position in soccer worth? A deep dive into the Premier League
content: Are attackers the most valuable players in soccer?  The answer is obvious and impossible -- at the same time.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Atalanta to test Inter, AFCON pressures Morocco
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? Inter Milan getting tested by upstart Atalanta, and more action for Africa Cup of Nation hosts Morocco.

title: 36 NFL rookies reveal the one big lesson they learned this season
content: Tyler Shough, Isaac TeSlaa and Jalon Walker were among the 36 rookies who learned how humbling and challenging the NFL can be.

title: 'Mr. Eligible': The growing fraternity of NFL sixth offensive linemen
content: NFL teams are using sixth O-linemen in more plays this season, and we're highlighting, yep -- six of them.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Christmas Day and all of Week 17
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Young risers to watch on all 30 teams
content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Gallagher loan, Atlético want €30m
content: Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher is the subject of interest from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How U.S. Soccer can grow the game with $100 million World Cup windfall
content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: Colton Herta's adaptation to F2 could define IndyCar's global reputation
content: Colton Herta left IndyCar for F2 in hopes of moving up to F1. Whether he succeeds could determine how the world views the American open-wheel series.

title: Trump's Christmas Gospel: Bombs, Blessings And Blame
content: Christmas under Donald Trump brought air strikes abroad and political threats at home, as the US president used the holiday to project a vision of power rooted less in peace than grievance, even as aides leaned into their Christian faith.

title: Zelensky Says Russia Using Belarus Territory To Target Ukraine
content: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday that Russia was using ordinary apartment blocks on the territory of its ally Belarus to attack Ukrainian targets and circumvent Kyiv's defences.

title: US Airlines Hit By Delays, New York Braces For Deep Snow
content: Airlines canceled more than 1,000 US flights during the peak Christmas travel period on Friday, with severe winter storm warnings and heavy snow forecast across parts of the Midwest and northeast.

title: 3 Women Injured In Knife Attack On Paris Metro, Suspect Arrested: Cops
content: French police on Friday arrested a man suspected of stabbing three women in the Paris metro as the capital's end-of-year festivities were in full swing, prosecutors told AFP.

title: Fire In Delhi's Chandni Chowk Shop, Dousing Operation Underway
content: A fire broke out in a shop in north Delhi's Chandni Chowk on Friday, prompting authorities to rush five fire tenders to the spot, an official of the Delhi Fire Services said.

title: Russia Boosted Weapon Production 22 Times Since Start Of Ukraine War: Putin
content: Russia has boosted the production of arms and ammunition by 22 times during the course of the Ukraine conflict, President Vladimir Putin said Friday.

title: India Remains Engaged With US, EU For Finalising Trade Pacts: Centre
content: India and the United States continue to remain engaged to finalise a mutually beneficial bilateral trade agreement (BTA), the government said on Friday.

title: Delhi's Air Quality In 'Very Poor' Category, AQI Slips To 332
content: After two days of brief relief, the national capital's air quality slipped back into the 'very poor' category at 332, with several monitoring stations recording 'severe' pollution levels.

title: Delhi Considering Revival Of Shared Taxi Rides To Curb Air Pollution
content: To curb air pollution, the Delhi government is considering reviving shared rides provided by ride-hailing services that were discontinued during the COVID-19 pandemic, officials said on Friday.

title: Israel Becomes 1st Country To Recognise Somaliland As 'Sovereign State'
content: Israel on Friday formally recognised Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" and signed an agreement to establish diplomatic ties, as the region's leader hailed its first-ever official recognition.

title: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq Drops Hurriyat Chairman Title From X, PDP Supports Move
content: After three decades, the All Parties Hurriyat Conference, an alliance of secessionist parties and leaders in Kashmir, is now literally non-existent.

title: Ex-Malaysian PM Najib Razak Jailed For 15 Years For Money Laundering
content: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.

title: Centre Launches First-Ever Weapon Database To Curb Terror
content: In a significant move to bolster India's fight against organised crime, terrorism, and extremism, the first-ever weapons database, the 'Lost, Looted and Recovered Firearm' database, was launched in India on Friday.

title: China Opens World's Longest 22 Km Expressway Tunnel In Xinjiang
content: China on Friday opened to traffic a 22.13-km-long tunnel, which it claimed to be the "world's longest", in Xinjiang province.

title: Nearly 10,000 Passengers In Navi Mumbai Airport In 2 Days Of Operations
content: Officials at the Navi Mumbai International Airport say the newly built terminal has clocked impressive passenger figures on the first two days of operations, with nearly 10,000 passengers using the airport.

title: Ex-Gangster Arun Gawli's Daughters File Nominations For Mumbai Civic Polls
content: Two daughters of gangster-turned-politician Arun Gawli filed their nomination papers on Friday for the January 15 Mumbai civic polls.

title: Aviation Watchdog Panel Submits Report To Government On IndiGo Disruptions
content: The four-member panel that probed the massive flight disruptions at IndiGo earlier this week has submitted its report to the aviation regulator DGCA, according to a senior official.

title: Charges Framed Against 2 For Attacking Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta
content: Setting the stage for trial, a Delhi court on Friday formally framed charges, including for attempt to murder, against two persons accused of attacking Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta at a public event earlier this year.

title: CBI Challenges Suspension Of Kuldeep Sengar's Jail Term In Unnao Rape Case
content: The CBI on Friday challenged in the Supreme Court the Delhi High Court order suspending the life sentence and bail to expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case, officials said.

title: "Translate It": Mehbooba Mufti Snaps At Journalist Asking Her To Speak Urdu
content: Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti on Friday snapped at a journalist here for asking her to speak in Urdu at a press conference.
